info.title: Box Platform API
info.description: [Box Platform](https://box.dev) provides functionality to provide access to content stored within [Box](https://box.com). It provides endpoints for basic manipulation of files and folders, management of users within an enterprise, as well as more complex topics such as legal holds and retention policies.

post.description:
Update a file's content. For file sizes over 50MB we recommend
using the Chunk Upload APIs.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Ensure this item hasn't recently changed
by ensuring the item's current `etag` matches the
`etag` passed into this header.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response unless explicitly specified, instead only
fields for the mini representation are returned, additional
to the fields requested.

parameters.name: Content-MD5
parameters.description:
An optional header containing the SHA-1 hash of the file to
ensure that the file was not corrupted in transit.

200.description: Returns the new file object in a list.

post.description:
Uploads a small file to Box. For file sizes over 50MB we recommend
using the Chunk Upload APIs.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response unless explicitly specified, instead only
fields for the mini representation are returned, additional
to the fields requested.

parameters.name: Content-MD5
parameters.description:
An optional header containing the SHA-1 hash of the file to
ensure that the file was not corrupted in transit.

201.description: Returns the new file object in a list.

409.description:
Returns an error if the file already exists,
or the account has run out of disk space.

post.description: Creates an upload session for a new file.

409.description:
Returns an error if the file already exists,
or the account has run out of disk space.

folder_id.description: The ID of the folder to upload the new file to.

file_size.description: The total number of bytes of the file to be uploaded

post.summary: Create upload session for existing file
post.description: Creates an upload session for an existing file.

file_size.description: The total number of bytes of the file to be uploaded

file_name.description: The optional new name of new file

409.description:
Returns an error if the file already exists,
or the account has run out of disk space.

get.description: Return information about an upload session.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload session.

put.description: Updates a chunk of an upload session for a file.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload session.

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description:
The [RFC3230][1] message digest of the chunk uploaded.

Only SHA-1 is supported. The SHA-1 digest must be Base64
encoded. The format of this header is as
`sha=BASE64_ENCODED_DIGEST`.

[1]: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3230

parameters.name: Content-Range
parameters.description:
The byte range of the chunk.

Must not overlap with the range of a part already
uploaded this session.

409.description:
Returns an error if the chunk conflicts with another
chunk previously uploaded.

412.description: Returns an error if a precondition failed.

416.description:
Returns an error if the content range does not match a specified range
for the session.

delete.description:
Abort an upload session and discard all data uploaded.

This cannot be reversed.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload session.

204.description:
A blank response is returned if the session was
successfully aborted.

get.description:
Return a list of the chunks uploaded to the upload
session so far.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload session.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the item at which to begin the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: Returns a list of parts that have been uploaded.

post.description:
Close an upload session and create a file from the
uploaded chunks.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload session.

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description:
The [RFC3230][1] message digest of the whole file.

Only SHA-1 is supported. The SHA-1 digest must be Base64
encoded. The format of this header is as
`sha=BASE64_ENCODED_DIGEST`.

[1]: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3230

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Ensure this item hasn't recently changed
by ensuring the item's current `etag` matches the
`etag` passed into this header.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description:
Ensures the changes are only applied if the
item's `etag` does not match the provided
`etag`, ensuring that the item is only updated
if the content has changed.

201.description: Returns the file object in a list.

202.description:
Returns when all chunks have been uploaded but not yet processed.

Inspect the upload session to get more information about the
progress of processing the chunks, then retry committing the file
when all chunks have processed.

Retry-After.description:
Indicates the number of seconds the client should wait before
attempting their commit request again.

409.description:
Returns an error if there is already a file with the same name
in the target folder.

412.description: Returns an error if the `If-Match` or `If-None-Match` conditions fail.

scopes.root_readonly: Read all files and folders stored in Box
scopes.root_readwrite: Read and write all files and folders stored in Box
scopes.manage_webhook: Create webhooks programmatically through the API

status.description: The HTTP status of the response.

help_url.description: A URL that links to more information about why this error occurred.

message.description: A short message describing the error.

request_id.description:
A unique identifier for this response, which can be used
when contacting Box support.

UploadSession.title: Upload Session
UploadSession.description: An upload session for chunk uploading a file.

session_expires_at.description: The date and time when this session expires.

part_size.description:
The  size in bytes that must be used for all parts of of the
upload.

Only the last part is allowed to be of a smaller size.

total_parts.description:
The total number of parts expected in this upload session,
as determined by the file size and part size.

num_parts_processed.description:
The number of parts that have been uploaded and processed
by the server. This starts at `0`.

When committing a file files, inspecting this property can
provide insight if all parts have been uploaded correctly.

allOf.description: A list of endpoints for this session.

UploadPart.title: Upload Part
UploadPart.description:
A chunk of a file uploaded as part of
an upload session.

sha1.description: The SHA1 hash of the chunk.

UploadParts.title: Upload Parts
UploadParts.description:
A list of uploaded chunks for an upload
session.

UploadPart--Mini.title: Upload Part (Mini)
UploadPart--Mini.description:
The basic representation of an upload
session chunk.

part_id.description: The unique ID of the chunk.

offset.description:
The offset of the chunk within the file
in bytes. The lower bound of the position
of the chunk within the file.

size.description: The size of the chunk in bytes.

File.title: File
File.description:
A full representation of a file, as can be returned from any
file API endpoints by default

version_number.description: The version number of this file

comment_count.description: The number of comments on this file

allOf.description:
Describes the permissions that the current user has
for this file.

tags.description: All tags applied to this folder.

allOf.description:
The lock held on this file. If there is no lock, this can either
be `null` or have a timestamp in the past.

extension.description:
Indicates the suffix, when available, on the file. By default,
set to an empty string. The suffix usually indicates the encoding
(file format) of the file contents or usage.

is_package.description: Whether the file is a package. Used for Mac Packages used by iWorks.

expiring_embed_link.description:
Requesting this field creates an expiring URL for an
embedded preview session in an iframe.

This URL will expire after 60 seconds and the session will
expire after 60 minutes.

allOf.description: Information about the watermarking on this file

allowed_invitee_roles.description:
Folder [collaboration](#collaboration-object) roles allowed by the
enterprise administrator.

is_externally_owned.description: Whether this file is owned by a user outside of the enterprise.

has_collaborations.description: Whether this file has any collaborators.

metadata.description:
A list of key-value pairs of metadata objects within their
scopes.

To access the metadata for a file, first use the
[Metadata](#metadata) endpoints to determine
the metadata templates available to your enterprise.

The use the [Retrieve File](#get-file-id) endpoint with
the `fields` query parameter to get the metadata by ID. The
ID for the metadata template will be in the format
`metadata.<scope>.<templatename>`, for example
`fields=metadata.global.properties`.

additionalProperties.description: The name of the metadata template

Reference.title: Reference
Reference.description: The bare basic reference for an object

id.description: The unique identifier for this object

SessionEndpoints.title: Session Endpoints
SessionEndpoints.description: A list of endpoints for a chunked upload session.

upload_part.description: The URL to upload parts to

commit.description: The URL used to commit the file

abort.description: The URL for used to abort the session.

list_parts.description: The URL users to list all parts.

status.description: The URL used to get the status of the upload.

log_event.description: The URL used to get the upload log from.

Pagination.title: Pagination
Pagination.description: The part of an API response that describes pagination

total_count.description:
One greater than the offset of the last entry in the entire collection.
The total number of entries in the collection may be less than
`total_count`.

limit.description:
The limit that was used for these entries. This will be the same as the
`limit` query parameter unless that value exceeded the maximum value
allowed. The maximum value varies by API.

offset.description:
The 0-based offset of the first entry in this set. This will be the same
as the `offset` query parameter.

order.description: The order by which items are returned

File--Standard.title: File (Standard)
File--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a file, as returned from any
file API endpoints by default

sha1.description: The SHA1 hash of the file.

size.description:
The file size in bytes. Be careful parsing this integer, it can
easily go into [exponent notation](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/\
Double-precision_floating-point_format).

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this file, starting at the root

created_at.description: When this file was upload to Boxâ€™s servers

modified_at.description: When this file was last updated on the Box servers

trashed_at.description: When this file was last moved to the trash

purged_at.description: When this file will be permanently deleted

content_created_at.description: When this file was created originally

content_modified_at.description: When this file was last updated

expires_at.description: When the file will automatically be deleted

allOf.description: The user who created this file
The user who last modified this file
The user who owns this file

The shared link object for this file. Will be
`null` if no shared link has been created.
The folder that contains this file.

item_status.description:
Whether this item is deleted or not. Values include `active`,
`trashed` if the file has been moved to the trash, and `deleted` if
the file has been permanently deleted

FilePermissions.title: File Permissions
FilePermissions.description: The permissions that the authenticated user has for a file.

can_annotate.description: Specifies if the user can place annotations on this file.

can_comment.description: Specifies if the user can place comments on this file.

can_preview.description: Specifies if the user can preview this file.

can_upload.description: Specifies if the user can upload a new version of this file.

can_view_annotations_all.description: Specifies if the user view all annotations placed on this file

can_view_annotations_self.description:
Specifies if the user view annotations placed by themselves
on this file

Lock.title: Lock
Lock.description: The lock held on a file.

allOf.description: The use who created the lock

created_at.description: The time this lock was created at

expired_at.description: The time this lock is to expire at, which might be in the past

is_download_prevented.description: Whether or not the file can be downloaded while locked

WatermarkInfo.title: Watermark Info
WatermarkInfo.description: Details about the watermark applied to this item

is_watermarked.description: Specifies if this item has a watermark applied.

Metadata.title: Metadata
Metadata.description:
A piece of metadata as specified by a metadata template and
applied to a file or folder.

$canEdit.description: Whether the user can edit this metadata

$id.description: 36-character UUID to identify the metadata object

$parent.description: An ID for the parent folder

$scope.description:
An ID for the scope in which this template
has been applied

$type.description:
A unique identifier for the "type" of this instance. This is an internal
system property and should not be used by a client application.

$typeVersion.description:
The last-known version of the template of the object. This is an internal
system property and should not be used by a client application.

$version.description:
The version of the metadata object. Starts at 0 and increases every time
a user-defined property is modified.

PaginationOrder.title: Pagination Order
PaginationOrder.description: The order in which a pagination is ordered

direction.description: The direction to order by, either ascending or descending

File--Mini.title: File (Mini)
File--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file, used when
nested under another resource.

sequence_id.description: A unique ID for use with the /events endpoint

etag.description:
The entity tag of this file object. Used with `If-Match`
headers.

Folder--Mini.title: Folder (Mini)
Folder--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file version, used when
nested under another resource.

sequence_id.description:
A unique identifier that can be used in combination
with the `/events` endpoint. May be `null` for
some folders such as the root folder and trash folder.

etag.description:
The HTTP etag of this folder. This can be used within some API
endpoints in the `If-Match` and `If-None-Match` headers to only
perform changes on the folder if (no) changes have happened.

User--Mini.title: User (Mini)
User--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a user, used when
nested within another resource.

name.description: The display name of this user

login.description: The primary email address of this user

SharedLink.title: Shared Link
SharedLink.description:
Shared links provide direct, read-only access to files or folder on Box.

Shared links with open access level allow anyone with the URL
to access the item, while shared links with company or collaborators access
levels can only be accessed by appropriately authenticated Box users.

url.description:
The URL that can be used to access the item on Box.

This URL will display the item in Box's preview UI where the file
can be downloaded if allowed.

This URL will continue to work even when a custom `vanity_url`
has been set for this shared link.

download_url.description:
A URL that can be used to download the file. This URL can be used in
a browser to download the file. This URL includes the file
extension so that the file will be saved with the right file type.

This property will be `null` for folders.

vanity_url.description:
The "Custom URL" that can also be used to preview the item on Box.  Custom
URLs can only be created or modified in the Box Web application.

access.description:
The access level for this shared link.

* `open` - provides access to this item to anyone with this link
* `company` - only provides access to this item to people the same company
* `collaborators` - only provides access to this item to people who are
   collaborators on this item

If this field is omitted when creating the shared link, the access level
will be set to the default access level specified by the enterprise admin.

effective_access.description:
The effective access level for the shared link. This can be a more
restrictive access level than the value in the `access` field when the
enterprise settings restrict the allowed access levels.

effective_permission.description: The effective permissions for this shared link.

unshared_at.description:
The date and time when this link will be disabled. This field can only be
set by users with paid accounts.

is_password_enabled.description: Defines if the shared link requires a password to access the item.

permissions.description: Defines if this link allows a user to preview and download an item.

can_download.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be downloaded. For
shared links on folders, this also applies to any items in the folder.

This value can be set to `true` when the effective access level is
set to `open` or `company`, not `collaborators`.

can_preview.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be previewed.

This value is always `true`. For shared links on folders this also
applies to any items in the folder.

download_count.description: The number of times this item has been downloaded.

preview_count.description: The number of times this item has been previewed.

Permissions.title: Permissions
Permissions.description: The permissions that the authenticated user has for an item.

can_delete.description: Specifies if the user can delete this item

can_download.description: Specifies if the user can download this item

can_invite_collaborator.description: Specifies if the user can invite collaborators to the item

can_rename.description: Specifies if the user can rename this item

can_set_share_access.description:
Specifies if the user can manage shared links for
this item

can_share.description: Specifies if the user can invite new collaborators to this item

Item.title: Item
Item.description: A generic mini representation of a file, folder, user or enterprise

sequence_id.description:
A unique ID for use with the `/events` endpoint. May be `null` for
some items, such as root or trash.

etag.description:
The entity tag of this item. Used with If-Match headers.
May be `null` for some folders such as root or trash.
